goals__remit:
As the “voice of young scientists around the world” the Global Young Academy (GYA) aims to empower and mobilize young scientists in their creative prime to address issues of particular importance to early career scientists and to advance science-society and science-policy dialogues. The GYA is an international organization that bridges the gap between the developing and the developed worlds, helping to make science around the world more effective in the discovery of new knowledge and its communication to society. 
 
In its activities, the GYA focuses on: 
•    Supporting young scientists in career development and independence  
•    Promoting interdisciplinary, international, and intergenerational dialogue on scientific issues 
•    Encouraging novel, scientific approaches to solve problems of international significance 
•    Building capacity for science in the developing world 
•    Developing science education and communication to encourage science as a career choice and for more effective, evidence-based decision-making 
•    Supporting the development and cooperation of National Young Academies.
